sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Elizabeth II's eight grandchildren visit the late monarch's coffin in Westminster Hall after King Charles III and Prince William greeted the long line of mourners outside.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Serbia's Euro Pride march goes ahead as planned after Prime Minister Anna Bernabech agrees to a shorter alternative route closely monitored by some 6,000 police officers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The eight grandchildren of Queen Elizabeth II, led by Prince William and his brother Harry, stood in silence for a 15-minute vigil surrounding the remains of the former monarch lying in state in the historic Westminster Hall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: William, who was now the heir to the throne, stood at the head of the flag-draped coffin as mourners filed quietly past. Some bowed and made the sign of the cross.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Outside, King Charles III and his son the Prince of Wales made an unannounced visit to a long row of people. They shook hands and greeted well-wishers in the kilometres long queue near London's Lambeth Bridge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The line accessing the interior of the burning chapel exceeds 24 hours of waiting. Earlier on Saturday authorities warned it was about to reach capacity, while London police say Monday's funeral will be the biggest security operation it has ever undertaken.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: After weeks of mounting tensions, the Pan Pride parade in Belgrade eventually went ahead as planned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Despite the initial police ban on the gathering, the court ban and the pressure on organisers and international actors to cull off the event, Serbia's Prime Minister Ana Bernabic gave the LGBTQ plus community and its allies the green light to march along a shorter route after organisers contacted the Interior Ministry on Friday and proposed an alternative path.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This is not an easy event to organise. I just want to remind everyone this is the first time we had the Euro Pride in not only Serbia, not only in Belgrade, but in South-East Europe, in the Western Balkans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Several thousand people set off from the Constitutional Court at the city stadium.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Fears that there might be clashes between the Pride marchers and the protesters on a so-called family walk, organised by the Conservatives who oppose events such as Pride, proved groundless as only minor scuffs with the police were recorded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: However, heavy downpours also played their part as both protests put together were heavily outnumbered by as many as 6,000 police.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This is a basic indigrient of a liberal democracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And as we're all hoping that Serbia is developing towards a liberal democracy and finally joining the European club, this is an important move to show that Serbia has finally arrived in the family of European countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Members of the European Pride Organisers Association chose Serbia's capital three years ago to host the annual event, hoping it would present a major breakthrough for the traditionally conservative Slavic country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And while Serbia has made gains for the community, anti-LGBTQ sentiment is still prevalent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Although Serbian law prohibits discrimination against LGBTQ people, the country has yet to legalise same-sex marriage or allow equal parenting rightsize same-sex marriage or allow equal parenting rights for same-sex couples.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A day after the president of Kyrgyzstan met with his Tajik counterpart and agreed to a ceasefire at the Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit in Uzbekistan, both sides have resumed armed clashes at their disputed shared border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This comes as fighting which broke out on Wednesday intensified on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The last major conflict on the Kyrgyz-Tajik border was in 2021 and claimed the lives of 205 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: While security chiefs from both countries have sat down overnight for fresh talks, their governments are trading blame for renewed shelling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Kyrgyz border authorities say at least 24 people have been killed, 121 injured and 136,000 residents have been evacuated from border areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: While so far Tajikistan has reported seven deaths and 14 injuries.

sentences.sentence: An anti-racism rally has hit the streets of Stockholm after the right and far-right bloc narrowly won the parliamentary elections on Wednesday.

sentences.sentence: After a two-year hiatus, Germany's famous Oktoberfest is back. And knocking in the first tap to open the beer-drinking festival was the mayor of Munich, Dieter Reiter, accompanied by Markus Söder, the Bavarian minister-president. The event will run until October 3, but due to much anticipation, some made a mad rush to be the first in, even before the official opening.

sentences.sentence: The San Sebastian International Film Festival is back and it kicks off this Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: On par with Cannes, Venice or Berlin, Spain's offering presents the very best of world cinema and in particular Hispanic film.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.sentence: The Centre Pompidou in Paris is honouring the painter and sculptor Gerard Garouste.

sentences.sentence: Born in 1946, he drew inspiration from mythology, the Bible, literary greats and the origins of culture.
